intro: Xanthophyllum korthalsianum, commonly known as the golden shield fern, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, giving it its common name. Xanthophyllum korthalsianum is often found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora.
